content:
When running ./tools/lint, i'm getting the error "Avoid using 'style' attribute". I've used the style attribute ( with minimal features) in quite a few places while creating a html template, so as not to alter any css files in static/styles. Can i override this in some way?

The work is in relation to issue #11016 (https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/11016)
We generally just modify the css files. Is there a reason youâ€™re reluctant to alter the css?

@Vishnu Ks Is it okay if i modify the css files? I'm not doing that coz i was asked not to touch any of the existing templates or css. Also, the changes are very minimal anyway. Maybe one or two features like text-align:center among others. I can add these directly to portico.css itself then.

@Shoumorup Mukhopadhyay yes, you should add them in portico.css. The instruction was to not modify the email templates at this stage -- since the goal of this project is to display the emails as they would be sent to make work on the email content more convenient, not to start work on the content.
